item.title: Messing with your Head – when to use WordPress template parts vs JavaScript
item.description: Here I am … I’m messing with your head. I wanted to see how easy it is to get my Isotope Visual Layouts plugin for WordPress to change your your homepage. item.title: Continuous Integration for WordPress Jenkins Selenium Apache Ant
item.description: I’m no regular WordPress Plugin Developer – I spend most of my day managing projects or other stuff. So when I do develop, I want a trusted, reliable, repeatable workflow setup that is always testing, always building and always telling me whats going on. That’s why I believe in Continuous Integration … and why I’ve turned to Jenkins as my CI Tool and use Apache Ant and Selenium for testing. A bit of background on Continuous Integration and Tools Continuous Integration Continuous Integration is a fundamentally different approach to software development where the project team work to continuously test as you build software.

item.title: HOW TO: Install Jenkins-CI on a Mac OS X with Git & Bitbucket
item.description: A few notes on getting Jenkins-CI installed on your Mac and setup with Git and Bitbucket for source code management. Issues with setting up Jenkins and Git on a Mac Here are the issues I was having … the biggest issue was the Error (unable to clone) which showed up when I created a job and added the path to the Bitbucket repo — even after I had added the SSH Key to Bitbucket.

item.title: Top Development Tools on my MacBook Pro
item.description: If you wanted to know what I apps and software I use every day then here you go … For starters this is all Mac OSx stuff. AxureRP 6.5 – wireframes and interactive prototypes. UX/UI Heaven Terminal – go command line (for SSH and most server stuff like testing with siege) Coda 2 – An all in one IDE – FTP, MySQL database, CSS, Editor and more … Transmit – only if I can’t be bothered to use Coda Firefox (and then only for these 2 extensions) SQLite Manager – SQLite may be the new mySQL … we’ll see Selenium IDE – for browser based testing (but only in Firefox) Sequel Pro – mySQL database manager SourceTree (as it works with Bitbucket) Other apps to know about MarsEdit – Best blog tool around for WordPress – but definitely room to improve Scrivener – for writing all that blog stuff Omnigraffle – when you can’t use Axure (and don’t have Visio) Pixelmator – who needs Photoshop Aperture – who needs Lightroom Netnewswire – I do all my RSS reading on the mobile now Cloud based stuff I use every day Google.

item.title: Sequel Pro – Fastest & best MySQL client for Mac
item.description: Sequel Prois the fastest and best MySQL client for Mac right now. So I did a quick check and downloaded a few other apps that would manage MySQL on a Mac with OS x – MySQL Workbench RazorSQL (not free so didn’t try) Navicat Both MySQL Workbench and Navicat are java based apps.

item.title: Rackspace - List of CIDR's for Testing with Blazemeter
item.description: I’ve just finished a WordPress multi-server development project which required a scalable deployment setup. We also needed to test the setup under load and ended up using Blazemeter (basically jmeter in the cloud). If you’re setup in Rackspace has a load balancer, you know you need to allow a number of IP’s by modifying the Access Control. Annoyingly there was no 1 list of the CIDR’s to allow. Blazemeter keeps a list of CIDR’sbut this couldn’t be cut n paste into Rackspace.
